yaak.agent.message
Class Executive

java.lang.Object
  yaak.agent.message.Executive
public class Executive
extends java.lang.Object

Executive provides core messaging functionality. These services support both broadcast and connection-oriented messages.

Version:
$Id: Executive.java 6 2005-06-08 17:00:15Z jsmith $
Author:
Jerry Smith

getCommunicationChannel

public final CommunicationChannel getCommunicationChannel()

Gets the executive's communication channel.

Returns:
The communication channel.

publishMessage

public final void publishMessage(AgentAddress source,
                                 AgentAddress target,
                                 Message message)
                          throws CommunicationException

Publishes a message to the specified address, usually a context.

Parameters:
source - The (logical) address of the source agent.
target - The (logical) address of the target agent.
message - The object that carries the pertinent data.
Throws:
CommunicationException - Either the sending channel is not operational, or the receiving agent cannot be located. Is the communication server running?

sendMessage

public final void sendMessage(AgentAddress source,
                              AgentAddress target,
                              Message message)
                       throws CommunicationException

Sends a message to the specified agent.

Parameters:
source - The (logical) address of the source agent.
target - The (logical) address of the target agent.
message - The object that carries the pertinent data.
Throws:
CommunicationException - Either the sending channel is not operational, or the receiving agent cannot be located. Is the communication server running?

receive

public final Message receive(AgentAddress source)
                      throws CommunicationException

Receives a message from the specified agent.

Parameters:
source - The agent/pod address of the sending agent.
Returns:
The object that carries the pertinent data.
Throws:
CommunicationException - Either the receiving channel is not operational, the receiver is already waiting on a message, or the sending agent cannot be located.

registerForMessages

public final void registerForMessages(java.lang.String agentName,
                                      MessageListener listener)
                               throws AgentException

Registers the message listener for agent-directed messages.

Parameters:
agentName - The symbolic agent name.
listener - The object for receiving messages.
Throws:
AgentException - The agent name is null, zero-length, or cannot be managed internally for an unspecified reason.

unregisterForMessages

public final void unregisterForMessages(java.lang.String agentName)
                                 throws AgentException

Unregisters the message listener for agent-directed messages.

Parameters:
agentName - The symbolic agent name.
Throws:
AgentException - The agent name is null, zero-length, or cannot be managed internally for an unspecified reason.

registerFilterForMessages

public final void registerFilterForMessages(java.lang.String agentName,
                                            MessageFilter filter)
                                     throws AgentException

Registers the message filter for agent-directed messages.

Parameters:
agentName - The symbolic agent name.
filter - The object for filtering messages (restricting message delivery).
Throws:
AgentException - The agent name is null, zero-length, or cannot be managed internally for an unspecified reason.

unregisterFilterForMessages

public final void unregisterFilterForMessages(java.lang.String agentName)
                                       throws AgentException

Unregisters the message filter for agent-directed messages.

Parameters:
agentName - The symbolic agent name.
Throws:
AgentException - The agent name is null, zero-length, or cannot be managed internally for an unspecified reason.
